name: A handheld aesthetic
description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

key_work.title: Sony Handycam DCR-SX65
key_work.brief_description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 debuted in 1985 and while other models from the era have been discontinued, it’s been made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but camcorders like this have captured footage that has social and political ramifications.

start.title: The Celebration
start.brief_description: A grandiose party to celebrate a sixtieth birthday unleashes a family drama with all the lies that conceal horrendous secrets. The eldest son, Christian, stages a showdown with the popular pater familias; his provocative, moving after-dinner speech dislodges all the masks, which finally fall completely as the father-son conflict intensifies and the bewildered guests look on.

end.title: The Idiots
end.creator_credit: Erik Schut, Marianne Slot, Peter van Vogelpoel and Vibeke Windeløv
end.headline_credit: Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain and Sweden, 1998
end.brief_description: With his first Dogma-95 film director Lars von Trier opens up a completely new film platform. With a mix of home-video and documentary styles the film tells the story of a group of young people who have decided to get to know their “inner-idiots” and thus not only facing and breaking their outer appearance but also their inner.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

links.description: Continuing in the Dogme 95 tradition, which amongst other things stipulated the use of handheld camera and natural lighting, The Idiots was one of Lars Von Trier’s more controversial films.

end.title: Tangerine
end.creator_credit: Chris Bergoch, Darren Dean, Karrie Cox, Marcus Cox, Sean Baker and Shih-Ching Tsou
end.brief_description: It’s Christmas Eve in LA and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn’t been faithful while she was in jail, Sin-Dee and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

links.description: Baker was influenced by Von Trier’s early work in the creation of Tangerine, which was shot on an iPhone. He was specifically impressed with the director’s ability to tell an impactful story on standard definition video.

end.title: Red Hook Summer
end.brief_description: Red Hook Summer is a 2012 American film co-written and directed by Spike Lee. It is Lee’s sixth film in his “Chronicles of Brooklyn” series following She’s Gotta Have It, Do the Right Thing, Crooklyn, Clockers, and He Got Game.

links.description: Another key influence on Baker’s creative process was Spike Lee’s Red Hook Summer, which featured numerous sequences shot by one of the young characters on iPad in the final edit.

end.brief_description: The 32 minute work by Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger won the 2018 Turner Prize, and explores themes of class, gender, sexuality and neolithic goddesses.
